title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1626-1.1 - Initial survey

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1626-1.1 - Initial survey

State Regulations

Authorities are required to manage buildings on site
and offsite property from time of acquisition until the time such buildings are
demolished. The first step in such management is to make a survey of the
tenants, both residential and commercial, in possession, as well as a physical
inspection of buildings and equipment. (a) The tenant survey should ascertain, for
each tenant, his name and address, present rent, family composition, total
family income, citizenship, plans for relocation, any adverse health conditions
existing in family, as well as any other data considered necessary in
relocating tenants. (b) The survey
of buildings and equipment should include janitorial services furnished, if
any, layout plans if possible, number of apartments broken down by size, heating system, type of utilities, health hazards and need for immediate action
with respect to those hazards, existing insurance coverages and other similar
data. The condition of the buildings in general and of each apartment, including the fixtures and other equipment, will be noted. A copy of this
building and equipment inventory will be forwarded to the Bureau of

Management. Notes
